title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.223 - Obsolescence
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.223 - Obsolescence

State Regulations

The loss in usefulness of an asset, occasioned by the
approach to the stage of economic uselessness through programs of the arts; economic inutility arising from external causes; disappearing usefulness
resulting from invention, change of style, legislation, or other causes having
no physical relation to the object affected. It is distinguished from
exhaustion, wear and tear, and deterioration, in that these terms refer to a
functional loss arising out of a change in physical
condition. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
ยง
441.223

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
